site_name: Land Junction Of Horn Lane / Western Avenue (A40) Opposite No

protected_spaces_details.description: Provision for children and young people

description: Erection of six storey 100 bedroom hotel (Class C1) and two residential blocks (three, four and six stories in height) comprising 72 one, two and three-bedroom units with associated access from Park View, basement car parking, coach parking, servicing, landscaping and a Green Corridor to Western Avenue and Horn Lane
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted. Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 13494 PA 109B Proposed Site Plan;13494-PA 126B Proposed Ground Floor GA Plan; 13494-PA 127B Proposed First Floor GA Plan;13494-PA 128B Proposed Second Floor GA Plan; 13494-PA 129B Proposed Third Floor GA Plan; 13494-PA 130B Proposed Fourth Floor GA Plan; 13494-PA 131B Proposed Fifth Floor GA Plan; 13494-PA 132B Proposed Roof GA Plan; 13494-PA 133B Proposed Basement; 13494-PA 134C Proposed Elevations 1; 13494-PA 135C Proposed Elevations 2; 13494-PA 136C Proposed Elevations 3; 13494-PA 137B Proposed Sections; IPD-14-300-115B Site Entrance Option C. Illustrative drawing: D2244L.201E D Combined Hard and Soft Landscape Plan; D2244L.201E.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning to ensure that the development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans, which have been, assessed against the CouncilÆs Development Plan. | Prior to the commencement of any phase of development (including site clearance and preparation), details of the acoustic barrier/green wall to be erected between the hotel and block B shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The acoustic barrier /green wall shall be designed to satisfy the acoustic criteria set out in SPG10 - Design Control Measures, as detailed in the attached Informative. The approved barrier/green wall shall be constructed before any of the dwellings in block B are occupied and shall thereafter be retained and maintained for the lifetime of the development.  Details of the planting scheme for both sides of the acoustic barrier/green wall and measures for the maintenance of the plantings shall also be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the wall is constructed. Such planting approved shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development.  Reason: To adequately protect future residents of the development from exposure to road noise, and to safeguard the visual amenity of the area and A40 Green Corridor in accordance policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and with policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to the commencement of any phase of development (including site clearance and preparation), a comprehensive Construction Management Plan Construction Logistics Plan for any phase of development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Construction Logistics Plan shall include the following:  "	The number of on-site construction workers and details of the transport options and parking facilities for them; "	Anticipated route, anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site per day; "	Delivery times and booking system (which is to be staggered to avoid morning and afternoon peak periods); "	Route and location of site access for construction traffic and associated signage; "	Management of consolidated or re-timed trips; "	Details of the noise / vibration and dust mitigation measures to accord with the 'Best Practice Guidance: The control of dust and emissions from construction and demolition ' (2006) and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites - Part 1:Noise; "	Wheel washing provision; "	Details of site security and the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate. "	Secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities; "	Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how construction vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear and including details of any  temporary vehicle access points; "	Details of the location(s) for storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices; "	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from members of the public; "	Measures to consult cyclists, disabled people and the local schools with regard  to delivery times and necessary diversions; "	Details of all pedestrian and cyclist diversions; "	A commitment to be part of Considerate Constructors Scheme; and "	Confirmation of use of TFL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar  Prior to the commencement of any site work, all sensitive properties surrounding the site shall be notified in writing of the nature and duration of the works to be undertaken, and the name and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed.  The information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the following guidance:  (i)	London Councils/Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition', 2006. (ii)	BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.   Development on any phase of works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved construction logistics plan, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the amenity of local residents and to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.11, 6.12, 6.14, 7.14, & 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(f),(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the Council's interim guidance contained in Supplementary Planning Guidance note 10: 'Noise and Vibration' and the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise'. | Before any phase of  the development is commenced, no development, other than site clearance and enabling works, shall commence until details (including samples where appropriate) of the materials to be used for the external surfaces for each of the buildings and hard-surfaced areas within that phase of development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with  Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2015). | Prior to the commencement of any works on any phase of development on site other than demolition and site clearance, (i) a contaminated land investigation for that phase of development shall be carried out, submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. The report of the findings must include:  (a) 	A survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;   (b) 	An assessment of the potential risks to:   "	human health,  "	property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes,  "	adjoining land,  "	groundwaters and surface waters,  "	ecological systems,  "	archeological sites and ancient monuments;  (ii) An appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s). This must be conducted in accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11'.   (iii) Submission of Remediation Scheme: No phase of development shall take place until a detailed remediation scheme to bring the site of that phase of development to a condition suitable for the intended use is submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.   (iv) Implementation of Approved Remediation Scheme:  The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of any phase of development other than that required tocarry out remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.   (v) Verification: Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme or schemes, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced, and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.  Reason: To protect the health and living conditions for future residents of the development in  accordance policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework. | Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, other than demolition and site clearance, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for the installation of Ultra Low NOx gas boilers with maximum NOx Emissions of fewer than 40 mg/kWh. The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the development complies with the air quality neutral building emissions benchmarks for the Class C3 use as stated in Appendix 5 of the Sustainable Design and Construction (2014) supplementary planning guidance, London Plan 2011.  Reason: To safeguard the amenities for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and with policy 7.3 of the  Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Before  any phase of development is commenced no development, other than site clearance and enabling works, shall commence until a drainage strategy for that phase of development detailing any on and/or off site  drainage works, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority (in consultation with Thames Water and the Environment Agency. The details shall be implemented fully in accordance with the approved scheme prior to first occupation of that phase of development unless an alternative timescale is agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. No discharge of foul or surface water from the site shall be accepted into the public system until the drainage works referred to in the strategy have been completed.   Reason: The development may lead to sewage flooding; to ensure that a sufficient capacity is made available to cope with the new development; and in order to avoid adverse environmental conditions impact in accordance with Policy 5.13 of the London Plan (2015), and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(m) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012). | Notwithstanding the approved M&E Services Strategy and Outline Energy Assessment for Planning Rev B, prepared by Couch Perry & Wilkes LLP (dated 17th September 2014, prior to commencement of any phase of development on the site, (other than site preparation works, site remediation or the formation of accesses), a detailed report and other supporting information providing details of the sustainability measures to be incorporated into that phase of development which demonstrates that the development will achieve an overall (minimum) reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by at least 35% (regulated carbon dioxide emissions) above Building Regulations 2013 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  In case an on-site CHP and / or a communal heating and cooling plant in the hotel is proposed, details of the size, layout and technical specification of the energy plant room to facilitate future connection to any neighbouring heating or cooling network shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.  Each phase of development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.   Reason: To ensure that sustainable design and construction measures to be incorporated into the approved development contribute to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policies LV5.2 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. |  Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, other than site clearance and enabling works, details of hard and soft landscaping to be provided within that phase of development, including any earth mounding; shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   This shall include the following comprehensive details of all trees to be planted:  "	Full planting specification - Tree size, species and the numbers of trees and details of meeting minimum rooting medium of 20-30m3/tree.  "	Positions of all proposed species. "	Comprehensive details of ground preparation. "	Staking/tying method(s). "	5 year post planting maintenance schedule with an agreed inspection schedule.  All tree-planting shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) to the completion of the approved development, unless agreed otherwise in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code Of practice For General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision.  All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions.  Any trees which within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting die, are removed, uprooted are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.  The hard and soft landscaping for any phase of development shall be subject to a Landscape Management Plan, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of that phase of development. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed in accordance with the approved landscape management programme for the lifetime of the development. No barriers or means of enclosure shall be erected within the landscape zone on the frontage of the site, of the site, other than the retaining wall as shown on the approved drawings.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and objectives for the A40 Green Corridor in accordance with policies 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, 7.8 & 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), polices 1.2 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7C & 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). |  Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, other than site clearance and enabling works, until full details of proposed extract ventilation systems for the enclosed sections of the proposed car park and service areas for that phase of development, shall be submitted to, and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include measures to mitigate noise, vibration and poor air quality. Such scheme shall be approved and installed to the Local Planning authority's satisfaction prior to the occupation of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the amenity of future residents, in accordance with policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(e) and 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and the Council's Supplementary Planning Guidance 3 'Air Quality and Pollution (draft) and adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, other than site clearance and enabling works, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works for that phase of development to protect sensitive rooms, gardens and balconies from external noise. The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria. The works, as approved, shall be completed before first occupation of that phase of development and thereafter permanently retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable traffic noise (which falls into Category C noise exposure) and also building services noise, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, other than demolition and enabling works, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for that phase of development of a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms - the supply to be provided from the rear of the buildings. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied.  Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable traffic noise (which falls into Category C noise exposure) and also building services noise, and poor air quality, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Before any phase of development is commenced, other than demolition and enabling works, details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority for that phase of development to demonstrate that the composite sound reduction index of the building envelope, Rw, will achieve the following criteria with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided:  "	The background L90, 15min linear noise level in any one third octave band from 50Hz to 160 Hz, and also the overall Linear L90 level, as previously measured at 1 m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected premises, shall not be increased when the amplified music or speech is played and the measurement is repeated in the same position, using L90 linear over any 5 minute period with the background and source operating together.  The measures shall be implemented as approved prior to the first occupation/use of the hotel and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). |  Before any phase of development is commenced, other than demolition and enabling works, details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority for that phase of development to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Before any phase of development is commenced, other than demolition and enabling works, details shall be submitted for approval of the Local Planning Authority for that phase of development for the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable odour abatement equipment including an extract system, the height of the discharge, and the efflux velocity of the effluent at the point of discharge.  The system, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained and maintained. The details submitted shall comply with the guidance from DEFRA named 'Guidance on the Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems, 2005'.	  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of future and adjoining occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Before any phase of development is commenced, other than demolition and enabling works, details shall be submitted for approval of the Local Planning Number for that phase of development of the, location and details of cycle parking to be provided on-site for the residential use and staff of the proposed hotel in accordance with adopted London Plan standards.  Reason: To ensure that adequate cycle parking provision is made to serve the development in accordance with adopted standards in the interests of promoting sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policy 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015) and Local Variation policies 6.13, 7A and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Before any phase of development is commenced, other than demolition and enabling works, details shall be submitted for approval of the Local Planning Authority of the location, width, length and gradient of two coach parking bays, to be provided on-site. The coach parking bays shall thereafter be implemented as approved and available for use prior to the first occupation of the hotel and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure that appropriate provision is made within the site for coaches, in accordance with policy 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015) and Local Variation policies 6.13, 7A and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to first occupation of any phase of the development hereby approved, a comprehensive Delivery and Servicing Plan for that phase of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall cover the following:  "	Traffic routing "	Restriction on size and number of HGV deliveries/movements per day        "	Deliveries and collections "	Servicing trips (including maintenance) "	Cleaning and waste removal "	Control of vehicle movements within the site "	Management and security of disabled parking "	Monitoring and review of operations  The delivery and servicing plan shall be implemented on first occupation of that phase of the development hereby approved and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety and the amenity of surrounding residents, in accordance with policy 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015) and Local Variation policies 6.13, 7A and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of any phase of development details of external lighting of that phase of development including communal amenity areas and any other areas within the site, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and implemented as approved and retained thereafter for the life of the development.  Reason: To provide a safe and secure external environment for occupants and users of the development and safeguard the amenities of surrounding residents in accordance with policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2015), policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); policy 1.1(h) of the Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and Ealing Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) Note 8: Safer Ealing. | Prior to the first occupation of any phase of development details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals at Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution 2011 will be met for that phase of development particularly with regard to the following:  (i)	Reducing glare by   "	Correctly aiming the luminaires "	Using luminaires with double asymmetric beams designed so that the front glazing is kept at or near parallel to the surface being lit "	Ensuring that the main beam angle of all lights, directed towards a potential observer is kept below 70 degrees.   (ii)	Controlling vertical illuminance with the lights operating to a maximum of 10 lux at ground level and 5 lux at first floor level at any affected facade.   (iii)	Demonstrating that the period of operation of the floodlights will be prohibited during the period 2200 to dawn, preferably by installation of an automatic time control switch.  The external lighting schemes shall comply with the advice given at BS 5389 with regards to upward light and light pollution and lighting of public amenity areas and relevant ILE and CIBSE guidance on the reduction of obtrusive lighting.  Reason: To safeguard the amenities of surrounding residents and  future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and with policy 7.3 of the  Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of any phase of development a Car and Cycle Parking Management Plan (in keeping with the draft Travel Plan) for that phase of development shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The Car and Cycle Parking Management Plan shall outline:              (i)        The proposed distribution, accumulation and arrangements for the management of: "	Visitor car parking; "	Residential car parking; "	Commercial car parking. (ii)	Measures for preventing parking in undesignated places throughout the site. (iii)	Within the development; the provision of active Electric Vehicle Charging Points (EVCP) for a minimum of 20% of the residential car parking spaces with an additional 20% passive; a minimum of 10% of the retail car parking spaces with an additional 10% passive; as set out in the London Plan 2011. (iv)	The safety and security measures to be incorporated within the development to ensure the safety of car/cycle parking areas. (v)	The Details including location, and where appropriate the design and appearance of the cycle parking for the internal and external storage for bicycles.  The car and cycle parking shall be provided and managed in accordance with the approved strategy for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure inclusive, safe and adequate parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in the interests of the general amenities of the locality, the flow of traffic and conditions of pedestrian and general highway safety within the site and on neighbouring highways, a sustainable development and where appropriate constrain local highway impact in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015), and policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) 1.1(g) and 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012). | Prior to the first occupation of any phase of development a final detailed Travel Plan for that phase of development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Car club vehicles shall be provided in accordance with the approved details if such provision is found to be viable. The final Travel Plan shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of that part of the development to which it relates.   Reason: In the interest of supporting measures that encourage shifts to more sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1 and 6.3 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(f), 1.1(g), 1.1(j),  1.1(k) and 1.2(k) of the the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and SPG 21: Sustainable Transport - Green Travel Plans. | Prior to first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved details of outdoor playspace, including their size and  location, and the  number and type of children's play features to be provided shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented and completed as approved prior to first occupation of the residential development and retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure that adequate on-site space for young children to play is provided on site in connection with the proposed residential accommodation, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.6, 5.3 and 7.2 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(e) and (i), 1.2 (d), 5.5, 6.2 & 6.3 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of any of the dwellings within the development, details of compliance with the lifetime homes standards shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details which shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1, 1.2 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Mana
site_number: Land Junction of Horn Lane / Western Ave
